entry.title: [Bitcoin Advent Calendar] History and Future of Sapio
entry.summary: In a recent post on his website, developer Jeremy Rubin provides insights into the origins of Sapio and its upcoming features. Sapio is an open-source smart contract platform built on top of Bitcoin that enables developers to create and deploy trust-minimized applications. Rubin explains that Sapio was originally conceived as a research project to explore ways to make smart contracts more secure and flexible. The resulting platform is designed to leverage the security of Bitcoin's blockchain while enabling developers to write smart contracts in familiar programming languages such as Python and JavaScript.In addition to bugfixes, Rubin notes that the Sapio team is currently working on several new features, including an improved user interface and a new smart contract language called "SapioScript." He also hints at upcoming partnerships and collaborations that could help expand the platform's reach and capabilities.Rubin's post serves as a useful introduction to Sapio and its potential for developers looking to build trust-minimized applications on top of Bitcoin. The platform's focus on security and flexibility, combined with its support for popular programming languages, make it an intriguing option for those interested in exploring the world of smart contracts.
